messages.title: Fighting for a Fairer Charnwood
messages.content: Labour announces more doctors and nurses for our NHS. The NHS is the beating heart of Britain.

messages.title: My Pledges to you
messages.content: Continue to build an economy growing with real jobs, paying living wages.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Repeal the Coalition’s Health and Social Care Act
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support the repeal of the Health and Social Care Act and stop the back-door privatisation of the NHS
Will oppose cuts, including those through the Bedroom Tax.
Seek to increase jobs, end zero-hour contracts, and ensure a living wage.
Work to ensure a transparent tax system where the rich and well off pay their due taxes, reintroduce the 50p tax rate for those earning over £150,000.

issues.economy: Continue to build an economy growing with real jobs, paying living wages. Real wages down £1600 since David Cameron became Prime Minister.
issues.education: Invest in young people by increasing education spending; guarantee apprenticeships; university tuition fees reduced.
issues.health: Labour announces more doctors and nurses for our NHS. The NHS is the beating heart of Britain.
issues.socialWelfare: Will oppose cuts to social services, including those through the Bedroom Tax.

housing.content: Seek to make housing more affordable and oppose the Bedroom Tax.

endorsements.endorsement: We are voting Labour as it's the only party that can protect our NHS.
We want a Labour government that will ensure every child from the earliest age has access to local educational and social support.
We will be voting for a Labour government at the election.

images.caption: Image of Sean Kelly-Walsh, with constituents' testimonials.
